channel.title: Auto mute

item.title: Auto mute
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“grandstinger, post:9, topic:546553”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=665452.msg4448616#msg4448616 date=1410117430]

If it’s a 634 +; Look at the Worldpacketsdecoder class under the packet “CHAT_PACKET” (Something like this)
Here’s an example of how i’d do it (actually not a snippet):

String[] messageFilter = { "noob" /*, "Insult here.. and so on"*/ }; //The Array where insults are listed for(String s : messageFilter) { //Iterating (Looping) through the array Player other = World.getPlayers(); //Getting all players in the current server, declaring them as "other" if(message.contains(s)) { //If it's the case that the message equals an entry in the array player.setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis() + 1440000); //Muting the player other.getPackets().sendGameMessage(player.getDisplayName+" has been muted for saying "+s+"."); //Game message sent to everybody } }

Anything else under 600: Idk

Hope i could help you
[/quote] ahh i was trying to do it in player.java ^^ i am using 667 source so it should be fine thx, /////// dw all i needed to know was put it in world packets decoder i made it, thx for the help

So, did you use mine or what?
Anyways, you’re welcome.[/quote] nahh i didn’t use yours, i posted the code i used at the top, thx anyway, you still helped me
[/quote]
Oh well, i wouldn’t prefer that way you’re using, but hey, everything for the lulz. You’re still welcome, feel free to make use of the code i’ve written !

Read full topic

String[] messageFilter = { "noob" /*, "Insult here.. and so on"*/ }; //The Array where insults are listed for(String s : messageFilter) { //Iterating (Looping) through the array Player other = World.getPlayers(); //Getting all players in the current server, declaring them as "other" if(message.contains(s)) { //If it's the case that the message equals an entry in the array player.setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis() + 1440000); //Muting the player other.getPackets().sendGameMessage(player.getDisplayName+" has been muted for saying "+s+"."); //Game message sent to everybody } }

item.title: Auto mute
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“grandstinger, post:1, topic:546553”]if someone says a word e.g noob, i need it to auto mute them,

i tried something like this but it kind of failed

if (getGameMessage.containsIgnoreCase(“noob”)) {
setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis()
+ (48 * 60 * 60 * 1000));
for (Player players : World.getPlayers()) {
if (players == null)
continue;
players.getPackets().sendGameMessage(getDisplayName() + “Has Just been<col=ff0000>Muted for saying noob!”);

         }

pls help[/quote]
If it’s a 634 +; Look at the Worldpacketsdecoder class under the packet “CHAT_PACKET” (Something like this)
Here’s an example of how i’d do it (actually not a snippet):

String[] messageFilter = { "noob" /*, "Insult here.. and so on"*/ }; //The Array where insults are listed for(String s : messageFilter) { //Iterating (Looping) through the array Player other = World.getPlayers(); //Getting all players in the current server, declaring them as "other" if(message.contains(s)) { //If it's the case that the message equals an entry in the array player.setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis() + 1440000); //Muting the player other.getPackets().sendGameMessage(player.getDisplayName+" has been muted for saying "+s+"."); //Game message sent to everybody } }

Anything else under 600: Idk

Hope i could help you

Read full topic

item.title: Auto mute
item.dc:creator: @grandstinger grandstinger
item.description:
@grandstinger wrote:

[quote=“Ivycial, post:4, topic:546553”][quote author=grandstinger link=topic=665452.msg4448514#msg4448514 date=1410104533]

#1, use code tags please.

#2, What class is this code in exactly? For one,

getGameMessage

does not invoke a method,

setMuted(

If this isn’t in the class with this method it doesn’t do anything at all.

basicly i need something to replace getGameMessage not sure how you say, “if a player says this”, i got the “then mute them” working
[/quote]

Do you mean a message? ‘You successfully muted the player A’ ‘You got muted by player B’ ? It’s released on Rune-Server and here just google it.[/quote]

this is what i want my code to do

if a player says noob in public chat
it mutes them for saying that word (noob)

Read full topic

item.title: Auto mute
item.dc:creator: @grandstinger grandstinger
item.description:
@grandstinger wrote:

if someone says a word e.g noob, i need it to auto mute them,

i tried something like this but it kind of failed

if (getGameMessage.containsIgnoreCase(“noob”)) {
setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis()
+ (48 * 60 * 60 * 1000));
for (Player players : World.getPlayers()) {
if (players == null)
continue;
players.getPackets().sendGameMessage(getDisplayName() + “Has Just been<col=ff0000>Muted for saying noob!”);

         }

pls help

managed it, i put this
Player.chatLog(player, message);
if (message.contains(“noob”)) {
player.setMuted(Utils.currentTimeMillis()
+ (3 * 60 * 60 * 1000));
player.getPackets().sendGameMessage(
“You have been muted for saying noob.”);
for (Player players : World.getPlayers()) {
if (players == null)
continue;
players.getPackets().sendGameMessage(player.getDisplayName() + “Has Just been<col=ff0000>Muted for saying noob”);
}
}
in world packets decoder

Read full topic
